Event.name: Protecting
Event.definition:
<def-root>Some <fen>Protection</fen> prevents a <fen>Danger</fen> from harming an <fen>Asset</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Protection">The rubber on her sneakers</fex> <t>protected</t> <fex name="Asset">her</fex> <fex name="Danger">from the mud</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Protection">The coral reefs</fex> <t>shielded</t> <fex name="Asset">the coastline</fex> <fex name="Danger">from the worst of the waves</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Protection">A growing number of sustainable farmers</fex> are preserving agricultural variety and <t>protecting</t> <fex name="Asset">biodiversity</fex> <fex name="Means">by raising ?heritage? or ?heirloom? varieties</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Protection">The man responsible for this entire ordeal</fex> <fex name="Event_description">cowardly</fex> <t>shielded</t> <fex name="Asset">himself</fex> <fex name="Danger">from justice</fex> <fex name="Instrument">with the little boy's struggling body</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Protection
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person, entity, or action that prevents harm to an <fen>Asset</fen>.
<ex><fex name="pro">The tabloid's deal with the woman</fex> <t>shielded</t> Schwarzenegger.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The place where the <fen>Danger</fen> threatened the <fen>Asset</fen>.
<ex>To make his way on a foreign soil, he needed different guardians from those that <t>protected</t> him <fex name="Place">in his own birthplace</fex> .</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time when the <fen>Danger</fen> threatens.
<ex>Regardless of the distribution media, USPTO information is <t>safeguarded</t> <fex name="Time">before, during, and after dissemination</fex> from improper access and modification.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Danger
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A situation that could damage the <fen>Asset</fen>.
<ex>Other nations tended to muffle or modulate their occasional annoyance with the country that was their <t>shield</t> <fex name="Danger">against the Soviet threat</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Asset
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protection</fen> which might be lost or damaged.
<ex>Almost 10 years later, that agreement <t>insulated</t> <fex name="Asset">Microsoft</fex> from liability on copyright claims over the graphical user interface (GUI).</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An event involving the <fen>Protection</fen> that removes the <fen>Asset</fen> from potential harm through the <fen>Danger</fen>.
<ex>Jackson <t>secured</t> the flank <fex name="mea">by timely charging the enemy and driving him back</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An entity directed by a volitional agent acting as a <fen>Protection</fen> which interacts with an undergoer to accomplish the security of the <fen>Asset</fen> from harm by the <fen>Danger</fen>.
<ex>Your Brake Pads Parts order is encrypted and <t>safeguarded</t> <fex name="ins">with the latest SSL technology</fex> for a protected and secure shopping experience!</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the protecting event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (<ment>hard</ment>, <ment>softly</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In cases of agentive <fen>Protection</fen>, it may indicate salient characteristics of an agent that also affect the action (<ment>carefully</ment>).
<ex>Finally, I thank all of the curators of all of the museums around the world who have <fex name="man">carefully</fex> <t>protected</t> the Ivory-billed specimens in their care.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Tthis FE is used for phrases that describe the protecting event as a whole. It applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness. The notion of appraisal requires a factive portrayal of the event. It also applies to descriptions of the protecting event as a role filler in another frame.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the act of protecting logically follows.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>FN: This FE denotes the length of time in which the <fen>Asset</fen> is protected.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>FN: This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. </def-root>

Arg.name: Beneficiary
Arg.definition: <def-root>FN: This extra-thematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the protecting event.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: protect.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: keep safe from harm or injury.

lexUnit.name: shield.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: protect from a danger, risk, etc.

lexUnit.name: protection [event].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or state of protecting or being protected.

lexUnit.name: protection [entity].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person or thing that protects.

lexUnit.name: safeguard.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a measure taken to protect or prevent something.

lexUnit.name: shield.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person or thing providing protection

lexUnit.name: bulwark.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a strong support or protection

lexUnit.name: guard.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to keep watch over some asset

lexUnit.name: shelter.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a shield against something harmful.

lexUnit.name: cover.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: protection, often from attack from above.
